intro: Stephanopodium cuspidatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stephanopodium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy surface. Stephanopodium cuspidatum is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats at high altitudes.
